refnamediv.refpurpose: returns a substring matching the regular expression to the supplied string

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The regexp_match function returns a copy of substring of string str which matches the regular expression pattern.

Previous behavior of this function would cut the first characters of str until the end of regular expression matched substring. In this way str could be passed to this function again to find the next occurrence of substring that matches the regular expression. By default this behavior is not adopted by this function, but can be enabled for pre 3.2 compatibility by supplying the optional third parameter.

If either the pattern or str parameter contain wide characters this function will operate in wide mode, first converting any narrow characters to wide and returning a wide character response. Otherwise this function operates in narrow mode by default.

refsect2.title: str
refsect2.para: The string to be searched. In compatibility mode (change_the_str =1) this string in modified, removing the matched substring.

refsect2.title: change_the_str
refsect2.para: This new parameter allows this function to operate in pre 3.2 compatibility mode which modified the original string. By default this parameter is set to "0" so that the original string is never altered.

refsect1.title: Returns
refsect1.para: This function returns the a substring matching the regular expression.
